result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelsea Santana Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $2,000 payable to The Crime Victim Compensation Program, joint and several to Calvin Clayton.

Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: credit for 388 days time served, concurrent to any other sentence.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

The defendant's reply brief is due on or before MARCH 3, 2016.

Counsel for the defendant shall obtain any necessary extensions from the Court of Appeals to allow the court sufficient time to decide the motion.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered restitution in the amount of $2,000 payable to The Crime Victim Compensation Program, joint and several to Calvin Clayton.

Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Karen S., Bethann B., Susie A.   The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 45 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 388 days time served, concurrent to any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 35 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
The defendant is remanded into the custody of Milwaukee Co. Sheriff, and ordered to report to Dodge Correctional.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, WEDNESDAY JULY 08, 2015 AT 8:15 A.M. IN BR 38, SB RM 502. kl
PSI given to Atty Robert Webb-per Atty Wright.
THIRD phone message left for Atty Wright that PSI is available for pick-up.
Copy of PSI printed to be given to Atty Wright.
PSI emailed to ADA Lewis.  Atty Wright contacted and message left.
Filed by the state: Restitution information

To the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court orders PSI and remands the defendant pending sentencing on 7-8-2015. Defendant to be produced from Kettle Moraine Correctional Institute.

Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the state, deleting the WHILE ARMED enhancer and adding Party to a Crime 939.05
State's Requested Jury Instructions
filed by the state

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Kelsea Santana Smith not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received state's offer to resolve.  Counsel will be meeting with defendant in depth to discuss offer. Atty Wright will contact the court if the case resolves short of trial.
May 12, 2015 @ 8:15A in BR 38, SB Rm 502 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Wright states that he has had difficulty getting the discovery to defendant.  Defendant has not had the opportunity to review the discovery.
Final pretrial documents have not been filed by defense.  Parties are requesting another final pretrial on 5-12-2015.

Attorney Edward Lee Wright in court, defendant Kelsea Santana Smith not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is serving a sentence at Dodge Correctional.  Co-defendant (15CF647) has entered a speedy trial demand; counsels do not believe that cases can be tried together.
Case set for final pretrial on 4-7-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-1-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-25-2015.

Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Calvin Clayton., Lamont M, Zahid Z., Jonathan P., Kiara C., Jasmine W., Deborah C., "MSW", Deborah W., Tyese T., Joel M. and victim, Eduardo V.'s family and mother of his child.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Kelsea Santana Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
